description: From French tontine, named after Lorenzo de Tonti, who introduced the scheme into France in around 1653. Can be decomposed as Tonti +â€Ž -ine.

entries.meaning: (finance, insurance) A form of investment in which, on the death of an investor, his share is divided amongst the other investors.
examples: There were many speculative schemes which gambled on the expectation of an individual's life, as in the tontine system, whereby all the group's contributions went to the last survivor.
